title: holiness
comment: The quality of God that sets him utterly apart from his world, especially in terms of his purity and sanctity. The holiness of God is also manifested in the persons and work of Jesus Christ and the Holy Spirit. Believers are called upon to become like God in his holiness.

children.title: holiness, as separation from the worldly
children.comment: God's people are called to holiness, which involves being distinct from other people. In the OT, this is seen in the command to separate from other nations and from everything that can compromise commitment to the LORD. In the NT believers are called to distance themselves from the ways and values of the world, which can be dishonouring to God and destructive to obedience to him.

children.title: Israel is to be set apart from other nations
Common things are designated clean or unclean by ritual law

The Israelites must distinguish between the holy and the common
Contact with the profane desecrates the holy
Unclean people and things must be removed
Unclean people are not to approach what is sacred
The holy must be treated with respect
Unintentional defilement of the holy carries a penalty
Warnings against contempt for the holy
Examples of contempt for the holy
Christians are called to be separate from the ways of the world
holiness, as set apart for God
children.comment: Believers are holy, in that they are called to be set apart from the world as God's own people. Likewise certain days and articles are holy because they are set apart for God alone.

children.title: Believers are called to be a holy people, set apart for God
Priests are consecrated for divine service
Articles are consecrated for divine use
Days and occasions set apart for God
Places identified with the presence of God are made holy
Things associated with worship are holy
holiness, purpose of
children.comment: God in his holiness desires a holy people amongst whom he can dwell, and who can effectively worship, witness to and serve him as they prepare for a future with God and to be like God.

children.title: The goal of holiness is to be like God
God dwelt with the people of Israel
Holiness is required for acceptable worship
Holiness is needed for effective witness
Holiness is needed for godly service
Holiness leads to a future hope
Holy people will receive eternal life
Holy people will inherit the kingdom
Holy people will judge the world
Believers' ultimate destiny is to share God's holiness for ever
holiness, believers' growth in
children.comment: Believers are enabled to grow in holiness on account of the sacrificial death of Jesus Christ, foreshadowed by the OT sacrificial system, and through the sanctifying work of the Holy Spirit.

children.title: God chooses who and what is to be holy
God chooses and calls his people to holiness
Holiness is conferred by the holy God
Holiness is conferred by the presence of God
Holiness is conferred through covenant relationship with God
Holiness is conferred by the sovereign action of God

primaryrefs.comment: The OT sacrificial system and holiness laws foreshadow the perfect sacrifice of Jesus Christ that enables believers to grow in holiness through faith.

children.title: Through the sacrifice of Jesus Christ
Holiness through the sanctifying work of the Holy Spirit
holiness, ethical aspects of
children.comment: Behaviour that reflects the holy character of God himself is to be expressed in both social and personal dimensions of life.

children.title: Holiness in practice is a reflection of God's own character
Holiness demands a different way of life
Holiness is expressed in social behaviour
A concern for truth and justice

seealsos.comment: Most of the OT law can be seen as an expression of holiness.

children.title: Holiness is expressed in family and sexual relations
Holiness is seen in personal character
